text: Hello everybody, thank you for helping me. I'm new HubSpot developer I'm charged to dev for my company so to explain my situation, HubSpot team copied our website and made templates... but to edit that it's not possible from drag and drop, I have to do it by code so that's why I'm learning from HubSpot developer page
I already have nodejs installed
<@U7SL518D6> I used this command `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli`
I have tried inside repository also but `hs init`  is showing  `command not found: hs`

Suggestion: _Donâ€™t force us to use spaces, if we prefer tabs._

We use Tabs (4). And if we prettify code, either with linting automatically does it, or manually, on all lines, it will also hit the declarative part, which the HubSpot parser needs.
If that part is indented with tabs, it will throw the following error.
```found character '\t(TAB)' that cannot start any token. (Do not use \t(TAB) for indentation)
 in 'reader', line 2, column 1:
        templateType: global_partial```
Edit: Also <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/226|created as an issue.>
I'm using the html jinja language and better jinja extension but every time I save all my formatting ie tabs disappear!

I must be doing something wrong. It's very frustrating having to add tabs back in to the code to give it structure every time I work on a file. Fortunately it's only one small file at the moment but this is the start of a full blown project. Any ideas what I'm doing wrong? May need to revert back to editing on HubSpot and then just use cms cli to transfer files back and forth between accounts but that's not ideal
after running the install command did your terminal show any errors?
I have these results

`npm WARN deprecated request@2.88.2: request has been deprecated, see <https://github.com/request/request/issues/3142>`
npm WARN deprecated resolve-url@0.2.1: <https://github.com/lydell/resolve-url#deprecated>
npm WARN deprecated urix@0.1.0: Please see <https://github.com/lydell/urix#deprecated>
/usr/local/Cellar/node/13.13.0_1/bin/hs -> /usr/local/Cellar/node/13.13.0_1/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hs.js
/usr/local/Cellar/node/13.13.0_1/bin/hscms -> /usr/local/Cellar/node/13.13.0_1/lib/node_modules/@HubSpot/cms-cli/bin/hscms.js
+ <@UFTV17Q03>/cms-cli@1.1.7
updated 2 packages in 13.949s

What this command should do is update you to the latest version of the CMS CLI.

Then any of the hs commands should work. As a test you could run `hs help` and you should get a listing of commands.
I tried to install latest but still not find hs command
npx hs help or npm hs help should do the trick no?
yes it works !
yea you just need to preface your hs commands with npx or npm depending on how you have it set up
well actually im asking myself if it's really necessary to make a local development or it is possible to edit and create template in design tools... what do you recommend?

If youre using themes - you can only initialize it from a local environment. But I think they are working on allowing you to do it from Design Tools.

I personally would rather work in my own editor where I have snippets and whatnot set up and emmet and autocompete. It helps make the coding aspect of things go a bit smoother. But there are some aspects of the local environment that take a bit of time to become comfortable with. Ie - making modules and adding fields to them and managine the meta data etc. But if you are going to be building a lot in hs I would def take the time to work with the CLI and Local  setup. It also makes it easy to utilize some kind of version control too. Which is another huge benefit.
But in design tools I can add something like this?
link: <https://www.HubSpot.com/careers/cambridge-ma>
I'm talking about the switch between list in table and display text
Oh yea - for sure - you can make modules and whatnot in design tools no problem.
I'm trying to learn from this guide: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/structure-and-customize-template-layouts#customizing-your-template>
but in my design tools I see html + HubL codes, do you have any idea why I don't see the same drag and drop?

That interface only applies to <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/building-blocks/templates/drag-and-drop-areas|drag and drop design manager templates>. We dont recommend those as coded templates in a theme using drag and drop areas provides the best editing experience for non-developers.
For a great getting started tutorial for developers see <https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started|https://designers.HubSpot.com/tutorials/getting-started>
